title.narrative: European Union (EU) for Civil Society in Libya

description.narrative: Civil Society Organisations (CSO), CSO Resource Centres, local authorities

EU for Civil Society in Libya is a new three year project with funding from the European Union. The project will support Libyan CSOs (grassroots and community-based), Libyan local institutions, authorities and municipalities, and people with influence, and public and private service providers to strengthen participation in decision making.

"Result 1: The institutional, organisational, and technical capacities of targeted CSOs are identified and strengthened through a needs based approach in municipalities. Result 2: Appropriate infrastructural capacity is in place to support CSO initiatives, increase civic engagement, facilitate knowledge sharing, and raise public awareness of CSO initiatives and successes. Result 3: Co operation between CSOs and engagement of CSOs in local governance is reinforced through the implementation of concrete initiatives in municipalities."

"The Overall objective of the project is to strengthen democratic governance, accountability, and local development in Libya by empowering civil society actors to participate in decision-making processes. Specific objective 1: The technical capacities, the effectiveness and the accountability of Libyan CSOs is improved; and Specific objective 2: Citizens, local authorities, and policymakers have increased awareness of CSOs’ role as partners in local development, planning, delivery, and monitoring."

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Directorate-General for International Cooperation and Development

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Redman Place, Stratford, London, E20 1JQ, UK

name.narrative: EU for civil societies in Libya is a national project, located in Tripoli and Benghazi. However, due to situation in Libya, some activities are currently delivered in Tunis.
